header.title: Racist vandals draw swastikas and write ‘moslem terrorists’ inside Islamic school
header.postText: An Islamic school has become the target of a hate crime after racist vandals broke in and graffitied ‘moslem terrorists’ on the walls.', 'The thugs also scribbled a swastika and overturned tables inside the Bahr Academy, in Newcastle, during the night of January 24.', 'Pictures of the school, which was once the set of TV series Byker Grove, show fire extinguishers and litter strewn on the floor.', 'Northumbria Police said they are treating the incident as a hate crime.', 'Sergeant Adrian Oakes, of the force’s central engagement team told Chronicle Live: ‘This type of mindless vandalism and blatant racism has no place in society and will be dealt with robustly by police.', '‘We would encourage any victims of hate crime to get in touch with police on 101 or through one of the many third-party reporting systems available online.', '‘Being you is not a crime and anyone found to be targeting a person because of who they should expect to be contacted by police.’', 'A fundraiser has now been set up online to try and help the academy and Madrasah recover from the attack.', 'So far £230 has been raised of the petition’s £3,000 goal.', 'The Islamic institute is a non-profit centre funded and run by those who want to ‘give education and faith the attention and importance it truly deserves’.', 'Online, their mission is described as instilling students with ‘academic success and excellence combined with a sublime character, compassion towards humanity and respect for people from all walks of life.’', 'The school was used as the setting for popular series Byker Grove and is a registered grade II listed building.', 'Newcastle City Council leader Nick Forbes said he was ‘outraged’ by the attack and called for the ‘scum who did this’ to be found and prosecuted.', '‘We must come together as a city to condemn such appalling racist hate crimes,’ he said.', 'While Facebook group Sunderland Unites poignantly likened the attack to the persecution of the Jews before and during World War Two.', '‘”Lest we forget,” they cry. Aye, lest we forget that the threat of fascism is real and in our faces,’ the post said.', '‘We stand in solidarity with our Muslim brothers and sisters and are disgusted at this, and the state of a society that breeds such hate.', '‘It’s Holocaust Memorial Day in a few days time. Wake up. Don’t let the past be the shape of our future.’', 'Councillor Habib Rahman, cabinet member for communities and chair of Safe Newcastle, said: ‘This was a vile attack which I condemn in the strongest of terms.', '‘Newcastle prides itself on being a tolerant and welcoming city where everyone can feel safe, so this criminal act offends us all.', '‘I have spoken to the head teacher and offered him the city council’s fullest support.’
